meanings.sent1: She was loth to leave her cozy bed on a cold morning.
meanings.sent2: The cat seemed loth to approach the unfamiliar dog.
meanings.sent3: He felt loth to try the strange-looking food at the party.
meanings.sent4: The old tree was loth to let go of its last autumn leaf.
meanings.sent5: The student was loth to ask for help, fearing embarrassment.

meanings.sent1: The sight of the slimy creature filled her with loth.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't hide his loth towards the foul smell in the room.
meanings.sent3: The loth on her face was evident as she tasted the bitter medicine.
meanings.sent4: His loth for spiders was so strong that he couldn't even look at a picture of one.
meanings.sent5: The loth in the air was palpable as they entered the abandoned house.

meanings.definition: Hesitant or unwilling to do something
meanings.sent1: She was loth to make a decision without more information.
meanings.sent2: The child was loth to try the unfamiliar food on his plate.
meanings.sent3: He felt loth to join the dance, fearing he would make a mistake.
meanings.sent4: The cat was loth to approach the water, unsure of its depth.
meanings.sent5: The hiker was loth to continue on the narrow, rocky path ahead.
